A Difficult Decision

A dim room, tension thickens.  
Sonia feels unease.  
Raskolnikov: “If you had to choose, who lives?”  

Sonia glances away, troubled.  
Sonia: “Why ask what can’t happen?”  
Raskolnikov: “You can’t decide even that?”  

---
A heart-wrenching moment, tears flow.  
Sonia: “Why am I a judge of life?”  
Raskolnikov: “Oh, if Divine Providence is involved…”  

Sonia, distressed, cries out.  
Sonia: “Are you here to torture me?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov questions Sonia about the moral implications of choosing between the lives of Luzhin and Katerina Ivanovna, leading to her distress and tears.
